ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 10-12 hours during weeks when papers were due. Otherwise, the workload was not time- consuming.
When working on the evaluation or the paper or the midterm there was work but it only came in waves.
2-5 depending on week
9 hours
~ 4 hours/ week
3-4 hours
5 hours per week
Given that we would work on the evaluation plan throughout the term, I would spend about 4-5 hours reading and writing each week.
2, but much more when projects were due
About 5 - 10 hours per week.
about 8

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: VERY PRACTICAL.

The course provided knowledge ands kills I believe will be useful post- YSPH. The instructor and TA are very approachable and willing to accommodate students' needs. I also like the fact that there was only one in-class exam- the midterm. The rest of the grade was made up of the course project and a critique of a published evaluation.While the course may be improved by requiring students to carry out an actual evaluation, I see how that may be difficult to achieve. On the whole, I would recommend the course.
it was common sense. Spent a lot of time learning material that is intuitive. Would be better if you could do an applicative rather than theoretical learning.
I like the applicability of it, but class time could be enhanced by having more workshops/activities vs. being lecture focused.
Skills learned from the course will be helpful and applicable once in the field but in the classroom it can be difficult to practice the learned concepts.
strengths: very practical skills, will definitely be useful laterweaknesses: boring lectures, midterm exam was a drag
no comments please

I expected to come out with more concrete skills, but I suppose that is the nature of program evaluation - it all depends on the context. I have a good understanding of the process now. Students should be told about the expectation to work with an outside org. prior to the first day of class if possible to begin talks with possible collaborators.
Strengths: professor's expertise.Weakness: not enough actual skill learning in class for studentscourse feels a little too didactic at times

Strengths: good overview, good distribution of grades, great final project, the critique assignment was greatWeaknesses: lectures were a little dry, there was a lot of overlap of methodology from other MPH classesI was looking forward to this course to give me practical experience. I liked the final project, but perhaps it could be structured in a way for it to be due earlier in the semester, have it graded and comments made, and then we revise it. This way, we can learn from out mistakes and understand what would be realistic in the real world.More case studies would be helpful. We did read a couple and talked about strengths/weaknesses but this could be expanded

I think that this course is generally ok, but some of the material feels redundant when taking other courses into account (e.g., quantitative methods). It might be helpful to have more exposure to evaluations that have been performed, perhaps integrating more critiques--I think this would help solidify some of the topics discussed and give students more practice in critically thinking about evaluation design, which would ultimately strengthen their own projects. Also, building in feedback about our own evaluations earlier in the semester might help. 2 weeks before they are due does not give time to make substantial changes, and the organizations as well as students might benefit from more formal feedback earlier.
Excellent course, enjoyed it thoroughly.
It is a very useful course combining both theory and practical experience. The content of the lectures is organized very well to match learning with practical design of evaluation plans.

The course gives a great overview of program evaluation. I would recommend this course to someone who already has a program in mind that they want to evaluate. Considering the fact that most of the students are in their second year, it would be helpful if the lectures could cover more material and go into more detail.

I personally liked the course very much and felt that it was very practical in terms of real-world experience. I got to interact with people from organisations outside of school, and it gave me insight into what consulting for an organisation would be like.

Evaluation is a great skill to learn -- the content overlaps some with epidemiology and research methods courses. Actually writing an evaluation plan was a great project and it was a lot of fun to work with a local organization.I would like to see less didactic material -- less lectures on content and more practical exercises, discussion.I enjoyed the evaluation critique -- more in class exercises like that could be helpful

The initial lectures were dry because we sat in class while the professor talked to us. This improved once we had sessions were we interacted with each other with group sessions in which we put what we were learning into practice. This was the best part of the course.
The course overall was good and helped develop some practical skills.
Very useful and practical material and skill development. Reading at times of that long, and not always clear what was required/expected.
It's a good course. Some of the lectures seem kind of repetitive from other courses though.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Denise Stevens  Sometimes would put me to sleep. Obviously knowledgeable but material is not presented in the most exciting way.
Instructor: Denise Stevens  Very knowledgable about evaluation and concerned about student progress.

Instructor: Denise Stevens  Instructor has lots of experience but very enthusiastic about the material. I think if lectures were more engaging and required readings then the class could be much better.
Instructor: Denise Stevens  instructor were very receptive to questions and feedback and available
Instructor: Denise Stevens  A very good instructor - i did not find any weaknesses

Instructor: Denise Stevens  Denise means well and has a very nuanced understanding of program evaluation, but she has to update her slide decks. I found the bright backgrounds and aggressive clip art very distracting. Kathleen was very helpful in critiquing our evaluation plan over the course of the semester.
Instructor: Denise Stevens  Great professor who cares about her students and is very open to feedback.

Instructor: Denise Stevens  Strengths: very approachable and friendly; willing to help students; knowledgeable and gave good adviceYou tried this with certain exercises in class but in the future maybe try a more interactive teaching style
Instructor: Denise Stevens  Dr. Stevens has a lot of experience and is a good resource for this kind of work.
Instructor: Denise Stevens  Great Professor, very good at teaching and made the course fun.

Instructor: Denise Stevens  The instructor provided a lot of help along the way to make sure the practical part of this course went smoothly. The instructor is experienced and very competent in teaching this course.

Instructor: Denise Stevens  Denise was great; she cared a lot about her students, and she used a lot of her own experience in relaying the material to the class, which I thought was really helpful. However, I enjoyed the interactive portion of the class more so than the didactic portion. I found that interactive sessions for this sort of class was more helpful than lecture notes, although the lecture notes were useful, too, of course.

Instructor: Denise Stevens  Good professor -- knows the course content very well. Could provide more interactive portions to class to make lecture more engaging. Also did not always provide detailed feedback on assignments.

Instructor: Denise Stevens  She seemed very knowledgeable about the materials that she taught. She had some helpful examples to provide to us of what and how she did what she did, and how everything tied into the current lecture. The problem was that there were many lectures where she did not provide useful examples of how what we were learning could have been applicable to the real world. Another strength was how the class and course work were organized so that everything flowed well. The time she had our critique due made sense given when we learned some of the skills needed to perform a critique.
Instructor: Denise Stevens  Denise is a fantastic instructor and sensitive to student needs.
Instructor: Denise Stevens  Very helpful. Well experience in the field. Able to answer practical questions regarding specific situations.
Instructor: Denise Stevens  I like her, but, as we talked about in class, the layout of the class probably needs a makeover. The powerpoints are kind of boring and most people weren't that engaged.
Instructor: Denise Stevens  Excellent

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  WORKED WELL WITH DENISE. ADDED VALUABLE INSIGHT
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Amazing - would always provide feedback and was super responsive and helpful.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Great feedback, very available

Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Kathleen was super accessible and helpful outside of class. She was willing to meet with us one-on-one and give us feedback with our evaluation which was invaluable.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  LOVE THE TA! always available! wonderful!
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  she was helpful through out the course.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Kathleen was very helpful in critiquing our evaluation plan over the course of the semester. I found her feedback to be more valuable than Denise's.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Great addition to class. Would like to hear more from her during lecture
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Kathleen was vary helpful and great at answering student questions
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Kathleen was great, very helpful and responsive.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Very caring and prompt at answering all our questions. Extremely helpful too!
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Very helpful and experienced. Provides clear explanation to concepts and class materials.

Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Kathleen was very, very helpful in terms of her feedback. She really focused her energy on every single student in class, and she knew exactly what each one of us was doing. I appreciated her feedback and used it to the best of my ability. She was also extremely quick with email responses.

Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Really wonderful! So helpful and always willing to meet to discuss projects. Provided very detailed very helpful feedback, which really helped develop the project! Loved her lecture as well!

Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  She was extremely knowledgeable. She gave very constructive feedback and was always willing to help. She is one of the best TA's that i have ever had the pleasure of working with.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Kathleen was a great TA. Very knowledgeable and very helpful with the final projects.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Kathleen was extremely helpful and went out of her way to be accessible, particularly around the time of various assignments being due.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Great!! Super helpful.
Instructor: Kathleen O'Connor Duffany  Excellent

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Ok!

In this course you get to plan an evaluation for an organization/program of your choice. It is a different experience than most courses but if you work with others, make sure they are people who will work hard.
I would recommend it if someone were interested in monitoring and evaluation otherwise I think the concepts can be self-taught.
anyone who wishes to gain practical skills involving health program evaluations (or plans to work with/help establish a community health organization) should take this course. lots to learn
No comments please
Good class. Feels more theory than actual skill learning, though creating an evaluation is helpful.
It's a great class to get practical experience. I'd recommend it because of the expertise of Denise and Kathleen.
Excellent course, fun to be a part of. Will definitely recommend to other students.
Great course to take if you want to learn the basic steps and components in designing an evaluation plan.

I would highly recommend this course for its real-world uses. The material might sometimes be dry, but the skills and lessons learned are totally transferable to any job or situation that any public health professional will encounter.
Good course with a practical component, but overlaps some with other material taught at YSPH. I would recommend it as a good way to work with another public health organization.
Very good course that is worth taking. Course would be an excellent if in the future there can be more inclusion of real world examples to make the material taught feel more relevant.
I would recommend the class to another student if they are interested in gaining some practical skills and learning more about how to evaluate health programs.

Excellent, very practical course. Essential if planning to work either developing community programming or evaluation of it. Workload was reasonable and performing a realistic program evaluation was helpful.
I can't decide.
Very Good
